citation.article-title: Microbacterium hatanonis sp. nov., isolated as a contaminant of hairspray.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Microbacterium hatanonis sp. nov.
Microbacterium hatanonis (ha.ta.no′nis. N.L. gen. masc. n. hatanonis of Hatano, in honour of Dr Kazunori Hatano, for his contribution to the understanding of the genus Microbacterium).
Microaerophilic; does not grow on TSA under an anaerobic atmosphere (CO2).
Typically, cells are rods, approximately 0.8 μm wide and 1.7 μm long.
Colonies are circular, convex with entire margins, moist, shiny and light yellow.
The temperature range for growth is 10–37 °C, with optimal growth at 30 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6.0–9.0, with optimal growth at pH 7.0.
No growth occurs at NaCl concentrations above 2 %; optimal growth occurs without the addition of NaCl.
Demonstrates positive results for catalase, aesculin hydrolysis, β-galactosidase and assimilation of glucose, arabinose, mannose, mannitol, maltose and potassium gluconate.

Gives positive results for the production of esterase, esterase lipase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and α-fucosidase.

Shows negative results for oxidase, nitrate reduction, indole production, d-glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, gelatin hydrolysis, utilization of N-acetylglucosamine, capric acid, adipic acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid and for the production of alkaline phosphatase, lipase, α-chymotrypsin and α-mannosidase.

The DNA G+C content is 69.0 mol%, the major isoprenoid quinones are MK-12 (37.5 %) and MK-11 (34.8 %) and the major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 (48.1 %), anteiso-C17 : 0 (34.7 %) and iso-C16 : 0 (10.5 %).
The cell-wall sugars are rhamnose and galactose.
Diamino acid ornithine is present in the cell-wall hydrolysates.
The type strain, FCC-01T (=JCM 14558T =DSM 19179T), was isolated from hairspray.
